sn11.11:4.2: “Mendicants, in a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he undertook seven vows. And it was because of undertaking these that he achieved the status of Sakka.
sn11.11:4.4: As long as I live, may I support my parents. As long as I live, may I honor the elders in the family. As long as I live, may I speak gently. As long as I live, may I not speak divisively. As long as I live, may I live at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share. As long as I live, may I speak the truth. As long as I live, may I be free of anger,
sn11.11:4.5: or should anger arise, may I quickly get rid of it.
sn11.11:4.6: In a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he undertook seven vows. And it was because of undertaking these that he achieved the status of Sakka.”
sn11.11:5.2: and honors the elders in the family,
sn11.11:5.3: whose speech is gentle and courteous,
sn11.11:6.1: who’s committed to getting rid of stinginess,
sn11.11:6.2: is truthful, and has mastered anger:
sn11.11:6.4: call them truly a good person.”
